articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets to Guinean President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets to Guinean President
Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Alpha Conde, president of the Republic of Guinea, on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the independence of the country.
					 Kim expressed his conviction that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Guinea would grow stronger in different fields.
					
					 He wished the president success in his responsible work and the friendly people of Guinea continuous progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Syrian Charge d'Affaires AI
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Syrian Charge d'Affaires AI
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Syrian Charge d'Affaires ad interim Tammam Sulaiman who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Swiss Foreign Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Swiss Foreign Ministry Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, separately met and had a talk with members of the delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Switzerland headed by Deputy Secretary of State Beat Nobs and Garcia Bires, new Angolan ambassador to the DPRK, who paid courtesy calls on him on Wednesday.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The North Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the National Reconciliation Council and the North Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification issued a joint statement on Wednesday on the occasion of the 6th anniversary of the publication of the historic October 4 declaration.
					 The declaration evoked unanimous support and welcome from all the Koreans as soon as it was published, and it serves as a banner encouraging the nation-wide general advance for reunification, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 Though the June 15 era of reunification underwent vicissitudes, the Koreans could advance along the road of reunification without setbacks thanks to the north-south joint declaration, signpost of hope.
					
					 The struggle to achieve the country's reunification is never a smooth path and the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad have become evermore desperate in their moves.
					
					 The Koreans are now standing at a crossroad of whether to preserve the north-south joint declaration or to allow the repetition of the vicious cycle of confrontation with compatriots. 
					
					 The North Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the National Reconciliation Council and the North Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification clarify the principled stand as follows in view of their noble mission before the history and the nation:
					
					 1: We will work to the last to thoroughly preserve and implement the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration which reflect desire and aspiration of all Koreans.
					
					2: We will resolutely foil the vicious moves of escalating confrontation between the two differing social systems and the moves to ignite a war on the part of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad which fan up distrust and hostility.
					
					3: We will fully promote the nation-wide solidarity and alliance to realize the nation's reconciliation and unity under the banner of the north-south joint declaration.

articles.title: DPRK Friendly Delegation Leaves for Iran
articles.content:
DPRK Friendly Delegation Leaves for Iran
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- A friendly delegation of the DPRK headed by Jong Yong Su, minister of Labor who is chairman of the DPRK-Iran Friendship Association, left here on Wednesday to visit Iran.
					 A delegation of the Institute for Diplomatic Strategy of Vietnam headed by its Director Hoang Anh Tuan arrived here and the delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Switzerland headed by Deputy Secretary of State Beat Nobs flew back home on the same day.

articles.title: AP Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
AP Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Associated Press headed by President and CEO Gary Pruitt arrived here on Wednesday.
					 It was greeted at the airport by Chon Il, vice director general of the Korean Central News Agency.

articles.title: National Software Exhibition in Field of Education Opens
articles.content:
National Software Exhibition in Field of Education Opens
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The 14th national software exhibition in the educational field was opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Wednesday.
					 Presented to the exhibition are more than 1,000 successful computer programs developed by teachers, researchers and students from at least 70 units in the educational field from across the country including Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Kim Hyong Jik University of Education and Nampho University of Agriculture.
					
					 The exhibition is divided into panels of information science of educational institutions and software.
					
					 The participants will introduce and swap successes and experience gained by universities and schools in the work for putting education on IT basis and in the development and use of programs including program for simulation experiment and practice and program for aiding education in the past period.
					
					 The exhibition will last till October 7.

articles.title: State Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
articles.content:
State Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles were awarded to intellectuals who made contributions to successes in building a thriving nation with due ceremony on Wednesday. 
					 Researcher of Kim Chaek University of Technology Jo Tok Hui received the title of academician and head of a department Ryom Pyong Ho and teacher of Pyongyang Medical College Choe Chan Sok of Kim Il Sung University and Director of History Institute of Academy of Social Sciences Jo Hui Sung received the title of candidate academician. 
					
					 The professorship went to Jo Yong Bong, rector of Law College of Kim Il Sung University; Kang Won Hyok, teacher of Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University; Jon Kyong Nam, president of University of National Economy; Ri Tong Sik, vice-rector of Wonsan Jong Jun Thaek University of Economics; Sim Jong Do, director of Vinalon Institute of Hamhung Branch of the State Academy of Sciences; and others. 
					
					 The doctorate was awarded to 49 including head of a department Jo Kil Hyon and office chief Jo Yong Nam of Kim Il Sung University, Jong Kwang Hyon, head of a department of Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, dean of a faculty Jong Thae Du, head of a department Kim Il Byong, director of an institute Ri Jun Gi, office chief Ri Son Hwa and teacher Jong Tok Yong of Kim Chaek University of Technology, and Rim Kon Yong, head of a department of Pyongyang University of Architecture. The title of associate professor was awarded to 118 people.

articles.title: Pyongyang University of Architecture in DPRK
articles.content:
Pyongyang University of Architecture in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang University of Architecture celebrated its 60th birthday on October 1.
					 When it was founded, the university had only nine departments. Now it has three colleges, several faculties, doctoral institute, architecture institute, building materials institute, etc. 
					
					 Over the past years teachers, researchers and graduates of the university have made significant contributions to building monumental edifices in the capital city of Pyongyang and other parts of the country.
					
					 The history of its development is associated with the devoted efforts of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung took a step to found the then university of construction in October Juche 42 (1953) after the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953). And he carefully guided the work for laying its material and technological foundations.
					
					 He developed it into the Pyongyang University of Construction and Building-materials Industry in the 1970s and indicated the orientation and ways for the university to follow, visiting it eight times. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il visited the university in the 1960s to set forth the tasks for improving the educational work and took measures one after another to properly adopt the teaching program and select the right educational system, faculty and subjects of study at the university.
					
					 He stressed the need for the university to creditably discharge its mission as a comprehensive center training personnel in the fields of construction, city and land management and environmental protection. 
					
					 In those days of their guidance to the university, Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il personally examined and highly appreciated the miniatures and designs of many buildings created by it, including Pyongyang Indoor Stadium, Grand People's Study House, Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, East Pyongyang Grand Theatre and Central Youth Hall and general review room of the Three-Revolution Exhibition House. 
					
					 In the past six decades the university has trained many architectural personnel by steadily improving the educational contents and teaching methods and solved lots of scientific and technical problems arising in construction and city management.
					
					 It produced many academic degree holders and state order-bearers, including more than 100 winners of the titles of DPRK Hero or Labor Hero.

articles.title: History of Changsong County Turned into Well-off Locality (3)
articles.content:
History of Changsong County Turned into Well-off Locality (3)
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime visited Changsong County, North Phyongan Province, on more than 60 occasions to guide its development.
					 In summer of Juche 51 (1962) when he was studying at Kim Il Sung University, he toured the county to learn in detail about its actual conditions and guide the preparations for the Changsong Joint Conference, which was called by President Kim Il Sung with an aim to developing the local economy and improving the livelihood of inhabitants in the mountainous areas.
					
					 In March 1964, he made public a historic work "The Position and Role of a County in Socialist Construction" to prove in a scientific and theoretical way the President's idea on the position and role of a county.
					
					 He energetically guided the work of Changsong County so that it could lead the whole country in a drive to improve county's economic life, exalting the President's feats for its development.
					
					 In July 1965 he stayed at a farm village of the county for several days to give field guidance to it. In those days he personally cut grass and carried bundles of grass together with peasants and even whetted sickles for them.
					
					 When visiting the county in October 2002, he said that the county's economic life should be managed assiduously in the spirit of the Changsong Joint Conference. In November 2010 he toured the county in disregard of cold weather and praised the progress of its local industry, calling upon all the cities and counties to bring about a fresh improvement in local industry by following its example. 
					
					 Under his energetic guidance, many counties turned into well-off localities with updated local industry.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms S. Korea-US "Mutual Defense Treaty"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms S. Korea-US "Mutual Defense Treaty"
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- It is impossible to achieve independent development of the nation, improve the north-south relations and achieve peace and the reunification of the country unless the criminal south Korea-U.S. "mutual defense treaty" legalizing aggression and war is scrapped. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in an article carried after the lapse of 60 years since the conclusion of the treaty.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The south Korea-U.S. "mutual defense treaty" is an aggressive, shackling and unequal one as it has disturbed inter-Korean reconciliation, unity and reunification and imposed upon the south Korean people only submission, disgrace, misfortune and disaster on the basis of justification of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces' permanent presence in south Korea and the moves for a war against the north. 
					
					 The U.S. has maintained and reinforced its military presence in south Korea on the strength of the treaty. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is not in a position to protest against arrogant GIs' all sorts of arbitrary practices but meets any demand of the U.S. just to please its American master. This is the deplorable reality brought about by the humiliating and shackling relations imposed upon south Korea by the treaty. 
					
					 The treaty is a main factor of creating an extreme danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and blocking the processes to mend the inter-Korean relations and achieve national reunification. 
					
					 Recently the U.S. has tightened its political and military ties with south Korea, vitiating the hard-won atmosphere of dialogue and escalating tension. 
					
					 What the treaty has brought to the Korean nation is nothing but continued division, deterioration of the north-south relations and increasing danger of a nuclear war. 
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that the treaty is a stumbling block lying in the way of achieving national sovereignty, peace on the Korean Peninsula and the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Anti-DPRK Campaign
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Anti-DPRK Campaign
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces are hurling the Intelligence Service and flesh traffickers into undisguised operations to lure and abduct inhabitants of the DPRK.    They are getting frantic with anti-DPRK smear campaign over "its human rights issue" even in the international arena. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday comes out with an article blasting these crimes.
					
					  These are unpardonable reckless acts against reunification and for confrontation as they are pushing the bedeviled inter-Korean relations to a more catastrophic phase, the article says and goes on:
					
					 With no rhetoric can the south Korean regime justify this campaign being staged to do harm to the social system of the dignified DPRK.
					
					 Luring and abducting people is branded as the gravest crime against humanity worldwide and this should be strictly banned in human society.
					
					 Yet, the regime is unhesitatingly perpetrating these hideous crimes under the signboard of "human rights". Its ulterior aim is to massively release misinformation hurling mud at the DPRK in a bid to make it sound plausible and build up public opinion on it. Its final goal is to destabilize the socialist system standing undeterred by any stern ordeal of history and realize its long-pursued scenario to invade the north.
					
					  This smear campaign of the regime would get it nowhere.
					
					  The more desperately the south Korean ruling forces persist in these operations, the more saliently they will reveal their unethical and treacherous nature.
					
					 The south Korean authorities had better behave themselves, cogitating about the serious consequences to be entailed by their smear campaign.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Force's Confrontational Farce
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Force's Confrontational Farce
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korea puppet forces Tuesday held an event to "commemorate" the formation of ROK army in the presence of the U.S. secretary of Defense and the chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary.
					 The puppet warmongers' action is little short of a poor farce to tighten military tie-up with their U.S. master, escalate the confrontation with compatriots and fan up the anti-north war fever, says the paper, and goes on:
					
					 Although they work hard to justify their action as one for "tightened alliance" they can never cover up their sycophantic and aggressive nature as they seek to do harm to the compatriots while selling off the nation's interests to foreign forces.
					
					 At the event they made public to the world Hyonmu-2 and Hyonmu-3 missiles and Israel-made guided missile Spike aimed to make a preemptive attack on the DPRK. They openly disclosed the deep-seated hostility while blustering about the "will of countermeasure" against the north.
					
					 The puppet conservative media agitated the invasion of the north, saying that "they can mount precision missile attacks on the whole areas of the north as well as on the north's long-range and coastal artillery pieces".
					
					 The inter-Korean relations recently deteriorated once again are attributable to the provocative action of the puppet warmongers who worked hard to pass the buck for the frayed inter-Korean relations and the tense situation to the north. But it will get them nowhere.
					
					 The confrontational farce staged in south Korea goes to clearly prove once again that the U.S. and the puppet forces are the arch criminals disturbing the north-south dialogue and straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: US, Western Forces' "Human Rights Offensive" Proves Futile: Minju Joson
articles.content:
US, Western Forces' "Human Rights Offensive" Proves Futile: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The "human rights offensive" of the U.S. and other western countries is now proving futile and the "main player" in the field of human rights is changing, observes Minju Joson Wednesday in an article. 
					 At present a lot of countries are disillusioned with the unjust behaviors of the U.S. and western countries as they are hell-bent on interfering in internal affairs of other countries under the pretext of "human rights issue", the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The 6th Beijing Human Rights Forum took place in Beijing recently.
					
					 The envoy for human rights of the Russian Foreign Ministry said at the forum that the issue of protecting human rights is being politicized by the U.S. and other western countries with each passing day. 
					
					 Many western countries use "human rights issue" for meeting their national and geopolitical interests and interfering in policies of other countries including regime change, he noted, adding that this is a main hurdle lying in the way of conducting constructive and mutually-beneficial international cooperation. 
					
					 Iran, Cuba, Belarus and other developing countries condemned the U.S. for frantically conducting surveillance and wiretapping at home and abroad and strongly urged it to stop at once all human rights abuses  at the 24th meeting of the UN Human Rights Council. 
					
					 Different countries term the "protection of human rights" touted by the U.S. a pretext for interfering in their internal affairs and stand firm against its practices. 
					
					 An example of this was Venezuela's withdrawal from the "American Convention on Human Rights". 
					
					 The international community is now becoming increasingly critical of the unjust acts committed by the U.S. and other western countries under the signboard of "protection of human rights" at a time when it is deeply concerned for the protection of human rights. 
					
					 Many countries are handling human rights issues on the basis of taking into consideration basic principles of national sovereignty and their own cultural and historic peculiarities, while rejecting the "human rights standard" peddled by the U.S. and other western countries.

articles.title: KCNA Accuses Japan of Challenging World Community
articles.content:
KCNA Accuses Japan of Challenging World Community
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Paris recently in protest against the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 It involved various events disclosing the barbarous atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialists, including hearing of a testimony made by a Korean woman who fell victim to the crime.
					
					 Its participants unanimously accused the Japanese authorities of denying Japan's crime-woven history and strongly urged them to make a formal apology and reparation for the crime.
					
					 Meanwhile, AFP, conveying the criticism made by French media of the Japanese imperialists' atrocities, predicted that worldwide censure of Japan's unjust behavior would grow stronger.
					
					 As a matter of fact, public in various parts of the world including the U.S., Japan and Philippines is becoming increasingly vocal demanding Japan redeem its past.
					
					 This indicates that the issue of sexual slavery has become an issue of world-wide concern the settlement of which brooks no further delay.
					
					 The world public is taking so serious note of the sexual slavery because it was the cruelest and most hideous crime against humanity in the 20th century.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists forcibly took away a great many women from various Asian countries and forced them into sexual slavery for their army, committing all sorts of evil doings against them.
					
					 They perpetrated such hair-raising atrocities as mercilessly violating the chastity of at least 200 000 Korean women and even massacring them.
					
					 Several decades have passed since then, but the victims are still suffering mental and physical pain as they were deprived of all essential rights of women.
					
					 What matters is Japan's wrong attitude toward this crime.
					
					Such shuddering acts as justifying the sexual slavery are getting evermore undisguised in Japan. 
					
					 The chief executive of Japan in his public appearance talked rubbish that "there is no evidence to prove the crime and issue of comfort women should be discussed by historians or experts at a quite place."
					
					 Politicians of Japan are letting loose such outbursts stunning world people as "Kono's statement which admitted the sexual slavery was a diplomatic error and the sexual slavery was required at that time." 
					
					 Hashimoto, co-head of the Japan Restoration Party, went the lengths of sending an open letter to the San Francisco City Assembly of the U.S. in protest against its condemnation of his reckless remarks justifying the sexual slavery.
					
					 Copying the above-said ridiculous behaviors, Japanese right-wing gangsters drove in a stake beside the statue of a girl sexual slave standing in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul and distributing worldwide a montage slandering the girl as a prostitute.
					
					 Moreover, they composed a song defaming the victims of the sexual slavery and made no scruple of committing such despicable acts as distributing CDs containing the song to those victims.
					
					 Japan is blatantly challenging the world public demanding it settle the issue of its sexual slavery.
					
					 Lurking behind this is its ulterior design to repeat its history of aggression one day at any cost, realize its old dream of the "Great East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" and regain its status as a leader of Asia.
					
					 The more desperate the Japanese reactionaries become in their moves to negate their past crimes, the more vigilant the world public will remain against them.
					
					 Japan sustained a bitter defeat in the war after challenging justice and human conscience in the last century.
					
					 It would be well advised to face up to the demand of the world public and the trend of the times and immediately opt for redeeming its past if it is not to repeat its inglorious past.

articles.title: Settlement of Issue of Part-time Job Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Issue of Part-time Job Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Part-time workers in south Korea held a rally in Seoul on September 28 urging the south Korean puppet authorities to settle the issue of part-time job.
					 The speakers accused the south Korean "government" of advancing a proposal for the measure calling for turning part-time jobs into those under indefinite contract recently. These jobs like part time jobs are subject to serious discriminations in such aspects as employment opportunity and wages, etc., they charged, adding such proposal cannot be a fundamental solution to the settlement of the issue of part time job.
					
					 The above-said jobs are little short of part-time jobs as they are different in description only, they held, and continued:
					
					 The "government" is keen to produce more part-time jobs although more than half of the workers are part-timers in south Korea.
					
					 They urged the authorities to rescind their hypocritical proposal and take a substantial measure for settling the issue.

articles.title: Improvement of Educational Conditions Called for by S. Korean Students
articles.content:
Improvement of Educational Conditions Called for by S. Korean Students
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- More than 8 000 students affiliated with the Federation of Students of Teachers' Colleges in south Korea held a rally in Seoul on Sept. 28 denouncing the south Korean puppet regime for its misrule against people.
					 At the rally the speakers blamed the present south Korean chief executive for failing to carry out her election commitment to improve the conditions for education.
					
					 On the contrary, she has taken such measures as increasing part-time jobs in the field of education, they charged, adding:
					
					 We will never tolerate such misrule as using education as a lever for making money.
					
					 They urged the "government" to carry out its commitments as early as possible.

articles.title: Festival in Japan Marks Anniversary of October 4 Declaration
articles.content:
Festival in Japan Marks Anniversary of October 4 Declaration 
 Tokyo, October 1 (KCNA-KNS) -- A festival to commemorate the 6th anniversary of the publication of the historic October 4 declaration was held in Tokyo, Japan on Sept. 29.
					 Present there were So Chung On, director of the international affairs and reunification department of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of the Korean Residents in Japan, Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, Kang Chu Ryon, chairperson of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, Son Hyong Gun, president of the Federation of south Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Reunification, who are vice-chairpersons of the Japanese Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, and Kim Cha Dol, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, Pak Tong Ho, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Students in Japan, Mun Se Hyon, chairman of the south Korean Youth League in Japan, delegates of Japanese civic organizations, young Koreans in Japan, students of Korea University and other Koreans. 
					
					 Speeches were made.
					
					 The speakers referred to the deep emotion that pervaded the country when the historic meeting of the top leaders of the north and the south was held in Pyongyang in October 2007 which culminated in the adoption of the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The Koreans in Japan are full of enthusiasm to preserve and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, reunification programme common to the nation and its practical programme, and achieve the country's reunification, they noted.
					
					 They called upon youth and students, who will become the master of the reunified country, to take the lead in ushering in a new phase of the country's reunification.
					
					 Introduced at the festival were messages of solidarity sent by the Youth and Student Sub-Committee of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and the Youth and Students Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration.
					
					 On the day, they held a candlelight march chanting slogans calling for the conclusion of the DPRK-U.S. peace agreement and implementation of the north-south joint declaration.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Observed by Koreans in Russia
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Observed by Koreans in Russia
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia issued a statement on September 30 to mark the 6th anniversary of the October 4 declaration. It urged the south Korean authorities to drop their anachronistic confrontation conception if they truly want the improved north-south relations.
					 The statement recalled that the historic north-south summit was held in Pyongyang in October, 2007 and the October 4 declaration was adopted there, drawing warm welcome and support not only from all Koreans in the north and the south but from the whole world.
					
					 But the slowly improving inter-Korean relations have again hit a snag due to the south Korean regime, it noted, and went on:
					
					 It is preposterous for the south Korean authorities to claim that the recent positive progress made in the north-south relations is entirely ascribable to their "theory of principle".
					
					 It is a well-known fact that the situation on the Korean Peninsula and the north-south relations, which had been extremely strained due to the racket kicked off by the U.S. and the south Korean regime to stifle the DPRK early this year began to improve thanks to the positive and generous peace-loving measures taken by the DPRK.
					
					 Dialogue between the authorities of the north and the south was held for restarting the operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone to be followed by the talks between their Red Cross bodies.
					
					 All this clearly indicates who truly stands for peace, cooperation and reunification and who pursues confrontation behind the scene of dialogue, seeking ulterior political purposes.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations should develop strictly on the basis of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Peruvian Organization Posts Kim Jong Un's Works on Its Website
articles.content:
Peruvian Organization Posts Kim Jong Un's Works on Its Website
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted on its website supreme leader Kim Jong Un's works "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" and "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" on September 26.
					 The first work, published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lives.
					
					 It indicates tasks to be fulfilled to defend and preserve the ideas and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and eternally glorify them.
					
					 The second work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), says that to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) is the principled requirement for victoriously accomplishing the cause of the Korean revolution. It indicates the tasks to be fulfilled to develop the WPK into the glorious party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Important Anniversaries of WPK Observed in Guinea
articles.content:
Important Anniversaries of WPK Observed in Guinea
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea released a bulletin on September 26 on the occasions of the 68th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 87th birthday of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					 The bulletin said in an article titled "Eternal general secretary of the WPK":
					
					 Though leader Kim Jong Il passed away all of a sudden in December, 2011 the Korean people have held him in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK.
					
					 His ideas and lines are the permanent guidelines of the WPK and exploits he performed while leading the party for several decades serve as a permanent driving force dynamically promoting the Korean people's cause of socialism.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is always alive with the ever-victorious WPK which leads the general march of the Korean people for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 In an article titled "Great leader of the mother party" the bulletin noted that today the people call the WPK the mother party, adding:
					
					 The great leader of the WPK is Kim Jong Un, its first secretary.
					
					 Love for the people serves as a starting point of his all thinkings and activities and supreme principle and highest aim of the politics pursued by him.
					
					 His love for the people reaches every nook and corner of the country: factories, villages, schools, kindergartens and nurseries.
					
					 The WPK headed by Kim Jong Un will win victory after victory as the mother party thanks to the absolute support and trust from the people.
					
					 The bulletin also carried an article titled "87th birthday of the Down-with-Imperialism Union".

articles.title: Birthday of WPK to Be Observed in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Birthday of WPK to Be Observed in Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- A Bulgarian preparatory committee for celebrating the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea was inaugurated on September 25.
					Dinko Zhelev, head of the Organizational Department of the National
					
					Council of the Bulgarian Socialist Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 It decided to organize colorful events including meeting and seminar and have newspaper, bulletin and other publications carried special write-ups on the occasion.

articles.title: Struggle of Korea for National Reunification Supported in Myanmar
articles.content:
Struggle of Korea for National Reunification Supported in Myanmar
 Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, released a statement on September 26 on the occasions of the 6th anniversary of the October 4 declaration and the 33rd anniversary of the publication of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK).
					 He said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung set forth the Three Principles of National Reunification through the July 4 joint statement in 1972 and advanced a proposal for founding the DFRK in October, 1980.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il formulated the proposals for reunification set forth by the President as three charters for national reunification and worked heart and soul for the reunification of the country.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration were made public thanks to his boundless love for the nation, broad magnanimity and great and courageous determination.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK, has wisely led the Korean people to accomplish the cause of national reunification true to the behests of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He clarified that he would join hands with anyone who truly wants the reunification of the country and the peace and prosperity of the nation, when referring to the issue of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The Korean people will surely achieve the cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I extend an unequivocal support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle for the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Alpha Conde
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Alpha Conde
Pyongyang, 2 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 2 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Guinea, Alpha Conde, por el 55o aniversario de la independencia de ese pais africano.
					En su mensaje, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Guinea se desarrollaran y se ampliaran en varios dominios.
					
					Formulo sinceros votos por los exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario y por el progreso y prosperidad continuos del amistoso pueblo guineo.

articles.title: Publicada declaracion conjunta con motivo del 6o aniversario de Declaracion del 4 de Octubre
articles.content:
Publicada declaracion conjunta con motivo del 6o aniversario de Declaracion del 4 de Octubre
Pyongyang, 2 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Comite Norteno por la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio, el Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional y la direccion nortena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria publicaron el dia 2 una declaracion conjunta con motivo del 6o aniversario de la publicacion de la historica Declaracion del 4 de Octubre. 
					En cuanto fuera publicada, la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre gano unanime apoyo y aplausos de toda la nacion y sirvio de bandera que estimula la marcha pannacional por la reunificacion, comienza el documento y prosigue: 
					
					Aunque la era de reunificacion del 15 de Junio sufrio pruebas, la nacion coreana pudo avanzar a pasos firmes por la unica senda de reunificacion renovando la esperanza con la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur. 
					
					No es facil la lucha por cumplir esa causa nacional y se tornan cada dia mas brutales las maniobras obstruccionistas de las fuerzas internas y externas anti-reunificacion. 
					
					Hoy dia, la nacion coreana se encuentra otra vez en el dilema de defender la declaracion conjunta Norte-Sur o repetir el circulo vicioso de confrontacion fratricida. 
					
					El Comite Norteno por la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio, el Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional y la direccion nortena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria exponen la siguiente posicion de principios partiendo de su noble mision asumida ante la historia y la nacion:
					
					Primero, lucharemos hasta el final para mantener y ejecutar cabalmente la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, que reflejan la aspiracion y el deseo de todos los connacionales. 
					
					Segundo, frustraremos tajantemente la brutal campana de confrontacion de regimenes y de provocacion de guerra de las fuerzas internas y externas opositoras a la reunificacion que agravan la desconfianza y la hostilidad entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					Tercero, desplegaremos audazmente la lucha solidaria pannacional para lograr la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales bajo la bandera de la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur.

articles.title: Develada estatua de bronce de Kim Jong Il en la Universidad Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Develada estatua de bronce de Kim Jong Il en la Universidad Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, 2 de octubre (ACNC) -- Se ha levantado en la Universidad Kim Il Sung, supremo plantel de educacion y ciencia de tipo jucheano, la estatua de bronce del Dirigente Kim Jong Il del periodo en que el desplego sus actividades revolucionarias en el citado plantel docente. 
					Gracias al levantamiento de la estatua, la Universidad se hizo la casa de altos estudios del Presidente Kim Il Sung y del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y puede transmitir generacion tras generacion las proezas del Dirigente realizadas por la formacion de talentosos revolucionarios para la construccion del Estado prospero y el desarrollo de la educacion y ciencia del pais. 
					
					Tuvo lugar la vispera la ceremonia de inauguracion de la estatua con motivo del dia de fundacion de dicha Universidad. 
					
					Asistieron Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae y otros cuadros del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, funcionarios de instituciones del partido y del Poder, ministerios y organos centrales, profesores, empleados y estudiantes de este plantel y de otras universidades capitalinas, funcionarios y empleados de unidades que contribuyeron al levantamiento de la estatua, funcionarios y ameritados de organos, empresas y fabricas en esta capital.
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y los de organizaciones internacionales y los integrantes del Cuerpo de Agregados Militares, acreditados en nuestro pais, los huespedes extranjeros y los estudiantes extranjeros que cursan en la Universidad Kim Il Sung. 
					
					Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Ki Nam y otros develaron la estatua. 
					
					Al revelarse la estatua del Dirigente, estremecieron las aclamaciones de "!Viva!", se tiraron las salvas artificiales y volaron los globos de goma. 
					
					Fue depositado ante la estatua el cesto de flores a nombre del Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Fueron colocados igualmente un cesto de flores a nombre comun del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC, y el otro a nombre de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.
					
					Quedaron depositados tambien los cestos de flores a nombre de los ministerios, organos centrales, universidades, instituciones, empresas y fabricas de la capital y las escuelas y facultades de la misma universidad.
					
					Todos los participantes rindieron tributo al Dirigente.
					
					El discurso de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y presidente del Presidium de la APS de la RPDC.
					
					El orador senalo que tener en la universidad la estatua de bronce del Dirigente junto con la otra del Presidente fue el unanime deseo de los profesores, empleados, estudiantes, graduados, padres de los estudiantes de la Universidad y todos los habitantes.
					
					Subrayo que este deseo se ha realizado con brillantez por la iniciativa y minuciosa direccion del Mariscal.
					
					Enfatizo que todos los estudiantes deben ser competentes recursos humanos de la revolucion, que se encargaran de construir un Estado prospero bajo la direccion del Mariscal, bandera de victoria eterna de la potencia del monte Paektu, como descendientes y discipulos de los Generalisimos y luchar por la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					Luego de escuchar la explicacion sobre la estatua, los participantes la recorrieron y visitaron el remodelado museo de la historia revolucionaria de la Universidad.
